newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Ringgit steady, seen in range despite easy dlr/yen.
newsitem.headline: Ringgit steady, seen in range despite easy dlr/yen.

text.p: * Ringgit steady after mild dollar selling in Sydney
* Seen in range despite weakness in dollar/majors
* Ringgit loses advantages as swaps, Malaysian domestic interest rates start coming off
* Dollar/ringgit could gain in near-term, dealers say
The ringgit was rangebound in mid-morning Asian trading after mild dollar sales helped it recover 20 points, dealers said on Friday.

"The market is very quiet. Earlier in the morning, some stops were triggered by boys in Sydney on dollar selling by U.S. funds," said a European bank dealer in Singapore. This followed some short-term long dollar positions being carried overnight.
Dealers said ringgit was now trading in a new range of 2.4950 to 2.5100 to a dollar as swap rates and domestic interest rates in Malaysia have started falling.
"Swap levels are returning to normal. There is less interest in the ringgit now," a U.S. bank dealer in Singapore said.
At 0200 GMT, the ringgit was at 2.5015/20 a dollar.
